result.execSummary:
All charges against Jason W. Wolfgram in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason W. Wolfgram is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court would like the parties to speak.

15CF62/adjourned initial and 16CF12/initial.  Defendant Jason W. Wolfgram in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires from def re status of counsel representation.  Def states he talked to SPD office and did not qualify; states he talked with Atty. Gleason of the Law Center; was instructed by Atty. G to make a request for court appointment or time to obtain retainer.  Court instructs def to pay $50/mo towards costs of Dean counsel with first payment due March 15th.  Court appoints Atty. Gleason to represent in both cases.  Def will have payment plan; Def will be required to repay R Co at case end.  3/16 at 11 for adj. initial.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 11:00 am.
